00002 # Name:    syntax.tcl
00003 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (trevorw@sgi.com)
00004 # Date:    06/11/2013
00005 # Brief:   Namespace that handles proper syntax highlighting.

00008 namespace eval syntax {
00009 
00010   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00011 
00012   variable filetypes {}
00013 
00014   array set lang_template {
00015     filepatterns       {}
00016     matchcharsallowed  {}
00017     tabsallowed        0
00018     casesensitive      0
00019     indent             {}
00020     unindent           {}
00021     icomment           {}
00022     lcomments          {}
00023     bcomments          {}
00024     strings            {}
00025     keywords           {}
00026     symbols            {}
00027     numbers            {}
00028     punctuation        {}
00029     precompile         {}
00030     miscellaneous1     {}
00031     miscellaneous2     {}
00032     miscellaneous3     {}
00033     advanced           {}
00034   }
00035   array set langs      {}
00036   array set curr_lang  {}
00037   array set themes     {}
00038   array set theme      {}
00039   array set curr_theme {}
00040   array set colorizers {
00041     keywords       1
00042     comments       1
00043     strings        1
00044     numbers        1
00045     punctuation    1
00046     precompile     1
00047     miscellaneous1 1
00048     miscellaneous2 1
00049     miscellaneous3 1
00050   }

00052   ######################################################################
00053   # Loads the syntax and theme information.
00054   proc load {} {
00055 
00056     # Load the supported syntax information
00057     load_syntax
00058 
00059     # Load themes
00060     load_themes
00061 
00062   }

00064   ######################################################################
00065   # Loads the syntax highlighting information.
00066   proc load_syntax {} {
00067 
00068     variable langs
00069     variable lang_template
00070     variable filetypes
00071 
00072     # Load the tke_dir syntax files
00073     set sfiles [glob -nocomplain -directory [file join $::tke_dir data syntax] *.syntax]
00074 
00075     # Load the tke_home syntax files
00076     set sfiles [concat $sfiles [glob -nocomplain -directory [file join $::tke_home syntax] *.syntax]]
00077 
00078     # Get the syntax information from all of the files in the user's syntax directory.
00079     foreach sfile $sfiles {
00080       add_syntax $sfile
00081     }
00082 
00083     # Add all of the syntax plugins
00084     plugins::add_all_syntax
00085 
00086   }
00087 
00088   ######################################################################
00089   # Adds the given syntax file to the total list.
00090   proc add_syntax {sfile {interp ""}} {
00091 
00092     variable langs
00093     variable lang_template
00094     variable filetypes
00095 
00096     # Get the name of the syntax
00097     set name [file rootname [file tail $sfile]]
00098 
00099     # Initialize the language array
00100     array set lang_array [array get lang_template]
00101 
00102     # Read the file
00103     if {![catch { open $sfile r } rc]} {
00104 
00105       # Read in the file information
00106       array set lang_array [read $rc]
00107       close $rc
00108 
00109       # Format the extension information
00110       set extensions [list]
00111       foreach pattern $lang_array(filepatterns) {
00112         if {[regexp {^\.\w+$} [set extension [file extension $pattern]]]} {
00113           lappend extensions $extension
00114         }
00115       }
00116       set lang_array(extensions) $extensions
00117       if {[llength $extensions] > 0} {
00118         lappend filetypes [list "$name Files" $extensions TEXT]
00119       }
00120 
00121       # Sort the filetypes by name
00122       set filetypes [lsort -index 0 $filetypes]
00123 
00124       # Add the interpreter
00125       set lang_array(interp) $interp
00126 
00127       # Add the language and the command launcher
00128       set langs($name) [array get lang_array]
00129       [ns launcher]::register [msgcat::mc "Syntax:  %s" $name] "syntax::set_language $name"
00130 
00131     }
00132 
00133   }
00134 
00135   ######################################################################
00136   # Deletes the given syntax file from the total list.
00137   proc delete_syntax {sfile} {
00138 
00139     variable langs
00140     variable filetypes
00141 
00142     # Get the name of the syntax
00143     set name [file rootname [file tail $sfile]]
00144 
00145     # Delete the syntax
00146     if {[set index [lsearch -index 0 $filetypes $name]] != -1} {
00147       set filetypes [lreplace $filetypes $index $index]
00148     }
00149 
00150     # Delete the langs
00151     unset langs($name)
00152 
00153     # Unregister the language with the launcher
00154     [ns launcher]::unregister [msgcat::mc "Syntax:  %s" $name]
00155 
00156   }
00157 
00158   ######################################################################
00159   # Loads the theme file information.
00160   proc load_themes {} {
00161 
00162     variable themes
00163     variable theme
00164 
00165     # Clear the themes and unregister any themes from the launcher
00166     array unset themes
00167     array unset theme
00168     [ns launcher]::unregister "Theme:*"
00169 
00170     # Load the tke_dir theme files
00171     set tfiles [glob -nocomplain -directory [file join $::tke_dir data themes] *.tketheme]
00172 
00173     # Load the tke_home theme files
00174     lappend tfiles {*}[glob -nocomplain -directory [file join $::tke_home themes] *.tketheme]
00175 
00176     # Get the theme information
00177     foreach tfile $tfiles {
00178       if {![catch { open $tfile r } rc]} {
00179         set name          [file rootname [file tail $tfile]]
00180         set themes($name) [list name $name {*}[read $rc]]
00181         [ns launcher]::register [msgcat::mc "Theme:  %s" $name] [list [ns syntax]::set_theme $name]
00182         close $rc
00183       }
00184     }
00185 
00186     # Sets the current theme
00187     set_theme [[ns preferences]::get Appearance/Theme]
00188 
00189     # Trace changes to syntax preference values
00190     trace variable [ns preferences]::prefs(Appearance/Theme)    w [ns syntax]::handle_theme_change
00191     trace variable [ns preferences]::prefs(Appearance/Colorize) w [ns syntax]::handle_colorize_change
00192 
00193   }
00194 
00195   ######################################################################
00196   # Called whenever the Appearance/Theme preference value is changed.
00197   proc handle_theme_change {name1 name2 op} {
00198 
00199     set_theme [[ns preferences]::get Appearance/Theme]
00200 
00201   }
00202 
00203   ######################################################################
00204   # Called whenever the Appearance/Colorize preference value is changed.
00205   proc handle_colorize_change {name1 name2 op} {
00206 
00207     set_theme [[ns preferences]::get Appearance/Theme]
00208 
00209   }

00211   ######################################################################
00212   # Sets the theme to the specified value.  Returns 1 if the theme was
00213   # set; otherwise, returns 0.
00214   proc set_theme {theme_name} {
00215 
00216     variable themes
00217     variable theme
00218     variable curr_lang
00219     variable curr_theme
00220     variable colorizers
00221     
00222     if {[info exists themes($theme_name)]} {
00223 
00224       # Set the current theme array
00225       array set theme [list none ""]
00226       array set theme $themes($theme_name)
00227 
00228       # Remove theme values that aren't in the Appearance/Colorize array
00229       foreach name [array names theme] {
00230         if {[info exists colorizers($name)] && \
00231             [lsearch [[ns preferences]::get Appearance/Colorize] $name] == -1} {
00232           set theme($name) ""
00233         }
00234       }
00235 
00236       # Update the current tab
00237       if {([set txt [[ns gui]::current_txt {}]] ne "") && (![info exists curr_theme($txt)] || ($curr_theme($txt) ne $theme_name))} {
00238         set curr_theme($txt) $theme_name
00239         set_language $curr_lang($txt) $txt 0
00240       }
00241 
00242     }
00243 
00244     return 0
00245 
00246   }

00249   # Returns a list of supported languages.
00250   proc get_languages {} {
00251 
00252     variable langs
00253 
00254     return [array names langs]
00255 
00256   }

00258   ######################################################################
00259   # Given the specified filename, returns the language name that supports
00260   # it.  If multiple languages respond, use the first match.
00261   proc get_default_language {filename} {
00262 
00263     variable langs
00264 
00265     foreach lang [array names langs] {
00266       array set lang_array $langs($lang)
00267       foreach filepattern $lang_array(filepatterns) {
00268         if {[string match $filepattern $filename]} {
00269           return $lang
00270         }
00271       }
00272     }
00273 
00274     return "None"
00275 
00276   }

00278   ######################################################################
00279   # Retrieves the language of the current text widget.
00280   proc get_current_language {txt} {
00281 
00282     variable curr_lang
00283 
00284     if {[info exists curr_lang($txt)]} {
00285       return $curr_lang($txt)
00286     }
00287 
00288     return "None"
00289 
00290   }

00302   ######################################################################
00303   # Sets the language of the current tab to the specified language.
00304   proc set_current_language {tid} {
00305 
00306     variable curr_lang
00307 
00308     # Get the current text widget
00309     set txt [[ns gui]::current_txt $tid]
00310 
00311     if {[info exists curr_lang($txt)]} {
00312       set_language $curr_lang($txt) $txt
00313     }
00314 
00315   }

00317   ######################################################################
00318   # Sets the language of the given text widget to the given language.
00319   proc set_language {language {txt ""} {highlight 1}} {
00320 
00321     variable langs
00322     variable theme
00323     variable curr_lang
00324 
00325     # If a text widget wasn't specified, get the current text widget
00326     if {$txt eq ""} {
00327       set txt [[ns gui]::current_txt {}]
00328     }
00329 
00330     # Clear the syntax highlighting for the widget
00331     if {$highlight} {
00332       ctext::clearHighlightClasses   $txt
00333       ctext::setBlockCommentPatterns $txt {}
00334       ctext::setLineCommentPatterns  $txt {}
00335       ctext::setStringPatterns       $txt {}
00336     }
00337 
00338     # Set the text background color to the current theme
00339     $txt configure -background $theme(background) -foreground $theme(foreground) \
00340       -selectbackground $theme(select_background) -selectforeground $theme(select_foreground) \
00341       -insertbackground $theme(cursor) -highlightcolor $theme(border_highlight) \
00342       -linemapbg $theme(background) -linemapfg $theme(line_number) \
00343       -warnwidth_bg $theme(warning_width) \
00344       -diffaddbg $theme(difference_add) -diffsubbg $theme(difference_sub)
00345 
00346     # Set default indent/unindent strings
00347     [ns indent]::set_indent_expressions $txt.t {\{} {\}}
00348 
00349     # Set the snippet set to the current language
00350     [ns snippets]::set_language $language
00351 
00352     # Apply the new syntax highlighting syntax, if one exists for the given language
00353     if {[info exists langs($language)]} {
00354 
00355       if {[catch {
00356 
00357         array set lang_array $langs($language)
00358 
00359         # Get the command prefix
00360         if {$lang_array(interp) ne ""} {
00361           set cmd_prefix "$lang_array(interp) eval"
00362           $lang_array(interp) alias $txt $txt
00363         } else {
00364           set cmd_prefix ""
00365         }
00366 
00367         # Set the case sensitivity
00368         $txt configure -casesensitive $lang_array(casesensitive)
00369 
00370         # Add the language keywords
00371         ctext::addHighlightClass $txt keywords $theme(keywords)
00372         ctext::addHighlightKeywords $txt $lang_array(keywords) class keywords
00373 
00374         # Add the rest of the sections
00375         set_language_section $txt symbols        $lang_array(symbols) $cmd_prefix
00376         set_language_section $txt punctuation    $lang_array(punctuation)
00377         set_language_section $txt numbers        $lang_array(numbers)
00378         set_language_section $txt precompile     $lang_array(precompile)
00379         set_language_section $txt miscellaneous1 $lang_array(miscellaneous1)
00380         set_language_section $txt miscellaneous2 $lang_array(miscellaneous2)
00381         set_language_section $txt miscellaneous3 $lang_array(miscellaneous3)
00382         set_language_section $txt advanced       $lang_array(advanced) $cmd_prefix
00383 
00384         # Add the comments and strings
00385         ctext::setBlockCommentPatterns $txt $lang_array(bcomments) $theme(comments)
00386         ctext::setLineCommentPatterns  $txt $lang_array(lcomments) $theme(comments)
00387         ctext::setStringPatterns       $txt $lang_array(strings)   $theme(strings)
00388 
00389         # Add the FIXME
00390         ctext::addHighlightClass $txt fixme $theme(miscellaneous1)
00391         ctext::addHighlightKeywords $txt FIXME class fixme
00392 
00393         # Set the indentation namespace for the given text widget to be
00394         # the indent/unindent expressions for this language
00395         ctext::addHighlightClass $txt indent ""
00396         ctext::addHighlightClass $txt unindent ""
00397         ctext::addHighlightRegexp $txt [join $lang_array(indent) |] class indent
00398         ctext::addHighlightRegexp $txt [join $lang_array(unindent) |] class unindent
00399 
00400         # Set the indent/unindent regular expressions
00401         [ns indent]::set_indent_expressions $txt.t $lang_array(indent) $lang_array(unindent)
00402 
00403         # Update the UI based on the indentation settings
00404         [ns gui]::update_auto_indent $txt
00405 
00406         # Set the completer options for the given language
00407         ctext::setAutoMatchChars $txt $lang_array(matchcharsallowed)
00408         [ns completer]::set_auto_match_chars $txt.t $lang_array(matchcharsallowed)
00409 
00410       } rc]} {
00411         tk_messageBox -parent . -type ok -default ok -message [msgcat::mc "Syntax error in %s.syntax file" $language] -detail $rc
00412       }
00413 
00414     }
00415 
00416     # Save the language
00417     set curr_lang($txt) $language
00418 
00419     # Re-highlight
00420     if {$highlight} {
00421       $txt highlight 1.0 end
00422     }
00423 
00424     # Generate a <<ThemeChanged>> event on the text widget
00425     event generate $txt <<ThemeChanged>>
00426 
00427     # Set the menubutton text
00428     if {[info exists [ns gui]::widgets(info_syntax)]} {
00429       [set [ns gui]::widgets(info_syntax)] configure -text $language
00430     }
00431 
00432   }
00433 
00434   ######################################################################
00435   # Adds syntax highlighting for a given type
00436   proc set_language_section {txt section section_list {cmd_prefix ""}} {
00437 
00438     variable theme
00439 
00440     switch $section {
00441       "advanced" -
00442       "symbols" {
00443         while {[llength $section_list]} {
00444           set section_list [lassign $section_list type]
00445           if {$type eq "HighlightClass"} {
00446             if {$section eq "advanced"} {
00447               set section_list [lassign $section_list name color modifiers]
00448               ctext::addHighlightClass $txt $name $theme($color) "" $modifiers
00449             }
00450           } else {
00451             set section_list [lassign $section_list syntax command]
00452             if {$command ne ""} {
00453               ctext::add$type $txt $syntax command [string trim "$cmd_prefix $command"]
00454             } else {
00455               ctext::add$type $txt $syntax class [expr {($section eq "symbols") ? "symbols" : "none"}]
00456             }
00457           }
00458         }
00459       }
00460       default {
00461         set i 0
00462         foreach {type syntax modifiers} $section_list {
00463           if {$syntax ne ""} {
00464             ctext::addHighlightClass $txt $section$i $theme($section) "" $modifiers
00465             ctext::add$type $txt $syntax class $section$i
00466           }
00467           incr i
00468         }
00469       }
00470     }
00471 
00472   }

00474   ######################################################################
00475   # Repopulates the specified theme selection menu.
00476   proc populate_theme_menu {mnu} {
00477 
00478     variable themes
00479 
00480     # Clear the menu
00481     $mnu delete 0 end
00482 
00483     # Populate the menu with the available themes
00484     foreach name [lsort [array names themes]] {
00485       $mnu add radiobutton -label $name -variable [ns syntax]::theme(name) -value $name -command [list [ns syntax]::set_theme $name]
00486     }
00487 
00488     return $mnu
00489 
00490   }

00492   ######################################################################
00493   # Repopulates the specified syntax selection menu.
00494   proc populate_syntax_menu {mnu} {
00495 
00496     variable langs
00497 
00498     # Clear the menu
00499     $mnu delete 0 end
00500 
00501     # Populate the menu with the available languages
00502     $mnu add radiobutton -label "<[msgcat::mc None]>" -variable [ns syntax]::curr_lang([[ns gui]::current_txt {}]) \
00503       -value "<[msgcat::mc None]>" -command [list [ns syntax]::set_language <None>]
00504     foreach lang [lsort [array names langs]] {
00505       $mnu add radiobutton -label $lang -variable [ns syntax]::curr_lang([[ns gui]::current_txt {}]) \
00506         -value $lang -command [list [ns syntax]::set_language $lang]
00507     }
00508 
00509     return $mnu
00510 
00511   }

00513   ######################################################################
00514   # Create a menubutton containing a list of all available languages.
00515   proc create_menubutton {w} {
00516 
00517     # Create the menubutton
00518     ttk::menubutton $w -menu $w.menu -direction above
00519 
00520     # Create the menubutton menu
00521     menu $w.menu -tearoff 0 -postcommand "[ns syntax]::populate_syntax_menu $w.menu"
00522 
00523     return $w
00524 
00525   }

00538   ######################################################################
00539   # Returns a list containing two items.  The first item is a regular
00540   # expression that matches the string(s) to indicate that an indentation
00541   # should occur on the following line.  The second item is a regular
00542   # expression that matches the string(s) to indicate that an unindentation
00543   # should occur on the following line.  Both of these expressions come
00544   # from the syntax file for the current language.
00545   proc get_indentation_expressions {} {
00546 
00547     variable langs
00548     variable curr_lang
00549 
00550     # Get the language array for the current language.
00551     array set lang_array $langs($curr_lang)
00552 
00553     return [list $lang_array(indent) $lang_array(unindent)]
00554 
00555   }

00557   ######################################################################
00558   # Returns the full list of available file patterns.
00559   proc get_filetypes {} {
00560 
00561     variable filetypes
00562 
00563     # Add an "All Files" to the beginning of the filetypes list
00564     set filetypes [list [list "All Files" "*"] {*}$filetypes]
00565 
00566     return $filetypes
00567 
00568   }

00570   ######################################################################
00571   # Retrieves the extensions for the current text widget.
00572   proc get_extensions {tid} {
00573 
00574     variable langs
00575     variable curr_lang
00576 
00577     # Get the current language
00578     if {[set language $curr_lang([[ns gui]::current_txt $tid])] eq "None"} {
00579       return [list]
00580     } else {
00581       array set lang_array $langs($language)
00582       return $lang_array(extensions)
00583     }
00584 
00585   }

00587   ######################################################################
00588   # Retrieves the value of tabsallowed in the current syntax.
00589   proc get_tabs_allowed {txt} {
00590 
00591     variable langs
00592     variable curr_lang
00593 
00594     # Get the current language
00595     if {[set language $curr_lang($txt)] eq "None"} {
00596       return 1
00597     } else {
00598       array set lang_array $langs($language)
00599       return $lang_array(tabsallowed)
00600     }
00601 
00602   }

00604   ######################################################################
00605   # Retrieves the value of lcomment in the current syntax.
00606   proc get_comments {txt} {
00607 
00608     variable langs
00609     variable curr_lang
00610 
00611     # Get the current language
00612     if {[set language $curr_lang($txt)] eq "None"} {
00613       return [list [list] [list] [list]]
00614     } else {
00615       array set lang_array $langs($language)
00616       return [list $lang_array(icomment) $lang_array(lcomments) $lang_array(bcomments)]
00617     }
00618 
00619   }

00621   ######################################################################
00622   # Returns the information for syntax-file symbols.
00623   proc get_syntax_symbol {txt startpos endpos} {
00624 
00625     if {[lindex [split $startpos .] 1] == 0} {
00626       return [list symbols: $startpos $endpos [list]]
00627     }
00628 
00629     return ""
00630 
00631   }
00632 
00633   ######################################################################
00634   # Returns the information for symbols that are preceded by the word
00635   # specified with startpos/endpos.
00636   proc get_prefixed_symbol {txt startpos endpos} {
00637 
00638     set type [$txt get $startpos $endpos]
00639     if {[set startpos [$txt search -count lengths -regexp -- {\w+} $endpos]] ne ""} {
00640       return [list symbols:$type $startpos [$txt index "$startpos+[lindex $lengths 0]c"] [list]]
00641     }
00642 
00643     return ""
00644 
00645   }
00646 
00647   ######################################################################
00648   # Returns the information for the given Markdown code string.
00649   proc get_markdown_ccode {txt startpos endpos} {
00650 
00651     if {([$txt get "$startpos-1c"] ne "\\") && ([$txt get "$endpos-3c"] ne "\\")} {
00652       $txt tag remove _code $startpos $endpos
00653       return [list [list [list ccode [$txt index "$startpos+2c"] [$txt index "$endpos-2c"] [list]] \
00654                          [list codemarkers $startpos [$txt index "$startpos+2c"] [list]] \
00655                          [list codemarkers [$txt index "$endpos-2c"] $endpos [list]]] ""]
00656     }
00657 
00658     return ""
00659 
00660   }
00661 
00662   ######################################################################
00663   # Returns the information for the given Markdown code string.
00664   proc get_markdown_code {txt startpos endpos} {
00665 
00666     if {([$txt get "$startpos-1c"] ne "\\") && ([$txt get "$endpos-2c"] ne "\\")} {
00667       if {([lsearch [$txt tag names $startpos]    _codemarkers] == -1) && \
00668           ([lsearch [$txt tag names "$endpos-1c"] _codemarkers] == -1)} {
00669         return [list [list [list code [$txt index "$startpos+1c"] [$txt index "$endpos-1c"] [list]]] ""]
00670       } else {
00671         return [list [list] [$txt index "$startpos+2c"]
00672       }
00673     }
00674 
00675     return ""
00676 
00677   }
00678 
00679   ######################################################################
00680   # Returns the information for the given Markdown header string.
00681   proc get_markdown_header {txt startpos endpos} {
00682 
00683     if {[regexp {(#{1,6})[^#]+} [$txt get $startpos $endpos] all hashes]} {
00684       set num [string length $hashes]
00685       return [list [list [list h$num [$txt index "$startpos+${num}c"] [$txt index "$startpos+[string length $all]c"] [list]]] ""]
00686     }
00687 
00688     return ""
00689 
00690   }
00691 
00692   ######################################################################
00693   # Returns the information for the given Markdown bold string.
00694   proc get_markdown_bold {txt startpos endpos} {
00695 
00696     if {([$txt get "$startpos-1c"] ne "\\") && ([$txt get "$endpos-3c"] ne "\\")} {
00697       $txt tag remove _italics $startpos $endpos
00698       return [list [list [list bold        [$txt index "$startpos+2c"] [$txt index "$endpos-2c"] [list]] \
00699                          [list boldmarkers $startpos [$txt index "$startpos+2c"] [list]] \
00700                          [list boldmarkers [$txt index "$endpos-2c"] $endpos [list]]] ""]
00701     }
00702 
00703     return ""
00704 
00705   }
00706 
00707   ######################################################################
00708   # Returns the information for the given Markdown italics string.
00709   proc get_markdown_italics {txt startpos endpos} {
00710 
00711     if {([$txt get "$startpos-1c"] ne "\\") && ([$txt get "$endpos-2c"] ne "\\")} {
00712       if {([lsearch [$txt tag names $startpos]    _boldmarkers] == -1) && \
00713           ([lsearch [$txt tag names "$endpos-1c"] _boldmarkers] == -1)} {
00714         return [list [list [list italics [$txt index "$startpos+1c"] [$txt index "$endpos-1c"] [list]]] ""]
00715       } else {
00716         return [list [list] [$txt index "$startpos+2c"]]
00717       }
00718     }
00719 
00720     return ""
00721 
00722   }
00723 
00724   ######################################################################
00725   # Returns the information for the given Markdown link string.
00726   proc get_markdown_link {txt startpos endpos} {
00727 
00728     if {[$txt get "$startpos-1c"] ne "\\"} {
00729       if {[regexp {^\[(.+?)\](\s*\[(.*?)\]|\((.*?)\))} [$txt get $startpos $endpos] -> label ref linkref url]} {
00730         if {[string index [string trim $ref] 0] eq "\["} {
00731           if {$linkref eq ""} {
00732             set cmd "syntax::handle_markdown_reflink_click $txt [string tolower $label]"
00733           } else {
00734             set cmd "syntax::handle_markdown_reflink_click $txt [string tolower $linkref]"
00735           }
00736         } else {
00737           set cmd "utils::open_file_externally [lindex $url 0]"
00738         }
00739         return [list [list [list link [$txt index "$startpos+1c"] [$txt index "$startpos+[expr [string length $label] + 1]c"] $cmd]] ""]
00740       }
00741     }
00742 
00743     return ""
00744 
00745   }
00746 
00747   ######################################################################
00748   # Returns the information for the given Markdown link reference.
00749   proc get_markdown_linkref {txt startpos endpos} {
00750 
00751     variable markdown_linkrefs
00752 
00753     if {[$txt get "$startpos-1c"] ne "\\"} {
00754       if {[regexp {^\s*\[(.+?)\]:\s+(\S+)} [$txt get $startpos $endpos] -> linkref url]} {
00755         set markdown_linkrefs($txt,[string tolower $linkref]) $url
00756       }
00757     }
00758 
00759     return ""
00760 
00761   }
00762 
00763   ######################################################################
00764   # Handles a user click on a references link.
00765   proc handle_markdown_reflink_click {txt ref} {
00766 
00767     variable markdown_linkrefs
00768 
00769     if {[info exists markdown_linkrefs($txt,$ref)]} {
00770       utils::open_file_externally $markdown_linkrefs($txt,$ref)
00771     }
00772 
00773   }
00774 
00775   ######################################################################
00776   # Parses an XML tag.
00777   proc get_xml_tag {txt startpos endpos} {
00778 
00779     set str [$txt get $startpos $endpos]
00780 
00781     if {[regexp -indices -start 1 -- {(\S+)} $str -> tag]} {
00782       set start [expr [lindex $tag 1] + 1]
00783       lappend retval [list tag [$txt index "$startpos+1c"] [$txt index "$startpos+${start}c"] [list]]
00784       while {[regexp -indices -start $start {(\S+)=} $str -> attribute]} {
00785         set start [expr [lindex $attribute 1] + 1]
00786         lappend retval [list attribute [$txt index "$startpos+[lindex $attribute 0]c"] [$txt index "$startpos+${start}c"] [list]]
00787       }
00788     }
00789 
00790     return [list $retval ""]
00791 
00792   }
00793 
00794   ######################################################################
00795   # Returns the XML attribute to highlight.
00796   proc get_xml_attribute {txt startpos endpos} {
00797 
00798     return [list [list [list attribute $startpos [$txt index "$endpos-1c"] [list]]] ""]
00799 
00800   }
00801 
00802 }
